content: PFF Panel 1 Seedly PFF 2019 CPF Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS) Asked by AnonymousAsked on 02 Mar 2019As a self-employed person, would it be more advisable to top up my SRS or CPF?What are the pros and cons of each option? I am concerned about the liquidity/lock in period, interest rate and definitely, tax relief. It would be helpful to touch about usages of CPF - housing, education or investment or SRS - investments.1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 17 Sep 2019For me, I will prefer SRS.In times of opportunities (or crisis) which happens more often for self-employed than a salaried guy, SRS is still liquid cash (with tax payment).When you need the cash for an opportunity, it is a godsend.PS: I don't even have an SRS, I keep cash in various short term loan and bank accounts for fast usage when needed.0 comments1
